page.title: 11QUESTIONNAIRE
page.content: During the day it was found that most of the younger generation were working and those remaining in the area were OAPs or young women with children. Of those questioned most had lived in Gilmerton for less than 20 years. Many people lived there as it was pleasant and convenient for their work. Crieff is used more than Perth as a shopping centre as it is nearer. There is a Youth Club and a W.R.I. in the village and most people feel this is enough. There is also a play area for the younger children behind the estate. Some of the complaints from the residents were of bad bus services, especially in the morning, and of a need for a crossing for the A85 which runs right through the village.
